urls.title: The Flood Hub
urls.description: Posted: 07/06/21 From 14th ‚Äì 18th May we are hosting a Sustainable Drainage Systems (SuDS) Focus Week, looking at what SuDS are, how they reduce flood risk, and the many benefits they provide. There will be examples of the types of SuDS you can install in your home and garden, and case studies of larger SuDS projects across the North West. Posted: 24/05/21 On 19 May 2021 four new flood warning services were launched in Coniston (Cumbria) Caton (Lancashire), and Worthington and Atherton (Greater Manchester)

tweets.text: I'm sharing these slides on #MentalHealthAwareness day as they demonstrate the dreadful effect #flooding has on people's #mentalhealth - find out if you are at risk of flooding and take action using the advice from https://t.co/vm9R4Zna4s  @TheFloodHub @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/EKStTJc85i

In the event of a #Flood it is important to know who to call. Make sure you save the @EnvAgency Flood Line number in your phone. Call 0345 988 1188.

#BeFloodReady #BePreparedNotScared https://t.co/D31TF3y8BG

@javelinsam @LBHhelp @EnvAgency Hi! Well, that's a bit bizarre, isn't it?! Best place to start is to log a formal report here so the correct team can follow this up with you: https://t.co/gmF7I3y0k0
All the best, Zoe

Kitchen roll is one of the top 3 #unflushables people have admitted to flushing down the toilet
 
Unlike toilet paper it doesn't dissolve & instead causes blockages
 
‚ùåNever flush kitchen roll down the loo 
 
üíöProtect your pipes & our #environment 

#Unblocktober @stwater https://t.co/IV3kqi1gL5

Day 60

The next environmental ticking time bomb will be toxic #PFAS and #PFOS chemicals polluting UK waters.

A regulatory vacuum.

When this breaks, remember you were told.
